definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: You came late to class, so you're not seeing the whole picture.
sentences.chinese: 你上學遲到了，以是你沒有瞅見工作的全數顛末。

sentences.english: " she echoed. "I think there are six or seven of them in existence.
sentences.chinese: 我想大約有六七個人，幾年前，我瞅見過他們。

sentences.english: Anyways, I hope you get this man, hit me back.
sentences.chinese: 反正，我相當期望您能瞅見這封信，給我歸信吧。

sentences.english: He usually went to the seaside, but one year he saw an ad in a newspaper "Enjoy country life.
sentences.chinese: 他常去海邊算不，有一年他瞅見報紙上的一個廣告。

sentences.english: Tell me what do you see?
Do you see the river over there?
sentences.chinese: 瞅見那邊的那條河了嗎？

sentences.english: Naturally, by adults see also being criticized, saying we selling food.
sentences.chinese: 自然，被大人瞅見了也是要遭罵的，說我們作踐糧食。

sentences.english: Looking down from the plane, we could see lights on the runway.
sentences.chinese: 從飛機上向下瞅，我們能瞅見機場跑道上的點點燈火。

sentences.english: He was once seen to come out of the place.
sentences.chinese: 有一次有人瞅見他從這裏走出來。

sentences.english: Is it you I espy jogging in the park this morning?
sentences.chinese: 我今天早上瞅見在公園裏有個人慢跑，是你嗎？

sentences.english: Later I came to see I was mistaken.
Through my smoke-filled eyes, I recognized your smile amongst the jeering.
sentences.chinese: 透過煙霧瀰漫的瞳眸，我瞅見你笑容底的嘲諷。

sentences.english: Do you see that river there?
sentences.chinese: 你瞅見那邊的那條河了嗎？

sentences.english: You know Ijust think they didnt see the talent that Ihad.
sentences.chinese: 我想，他們底子沒瞅見我的先天。

sentences.english: When he saw little Thumbelina in her tiny cradle, he croaked with delight.
sentences.chinese: 當他瞅見小牀裏的拇指姑娘時，興奮的呱呱大叫起來。

sentences.english: If only I had seen it.
